metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15473 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
OpenSSH through 7.7 is prone to a user enumeration vulnerability due to notdelaying bailout for an invalid authenticating user until after the packetcontaining the request has been fully parsed, related to auth2-gss.c,auth2-hostbased.c, and auth2-pubkey.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssh package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.11').
